structure.comment: When you have a repeatable action that has child actions, when the child actions occur, they are linked to the LAST unlockedinstance of the parent. For example: check a particular remote state (e.g. document signature) until it is signed, then we can continue. Note that there is no min occurs because the flow pathing will determine whether it can be skipped or not.
structure.name: processAction

field.comment: A further description of this step
field.name: description

field.comment: Services can have references for logical naming
field.name: reference

field.comment: If this is an automatic action, it will be created as a task
field.name: automatic

field.comment: If it is reprocessable, we will store the input
field.name: reprocessable

field.comment: You can set a delay on the action to be executed
field.name: delay

field.comment: You can execute this action according to a schedule
field.name: schedule

field.comment: If you fill this in, when the action is done, we move to the result state. Note that all mandatory actions with the same result state must be run!
field.name: resultStateId

field.comment: How many times it can be run (0 = unlimited), default is 1
field.name: maxOccurs

field.comment: When it is marked as a singleton and it has a maxoccurs of > 1, the previous running instances (and their children) are locked.
field.name: singleton

field.comment: An action can be repeated until a certain condition is met. This condition must be derived from the captured variables.
field.name: repeatUntil

field.comment: The actor that is allowed to do this
field.name: processActorId

field.comment: The permission (if any) that the actor must have to execute this
field.name: permission

field.comment: There are a number of action types, for example a service call is an action type, so is a finalizer.
field.name: actionType

field.comment: Additional configuration for that given action type
field.name: configuration

field.comment: If it's a service action, the service id to track. A dedicated field for fast lookup.
field.name: serviceId

field.comment: If the action is set to strict, we will stop the service from executing if not allowed. Otherwise we simply don't log it
field.name: strict

field.comment: Defaults are: correlationId, userId, deviceId, sessionId, custom. Once custom you need to set up captures.
field.name: identificationType
